Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> FYI our new Superlite wallet will be based on this: https://github.com/theblackmallard/nspv_pywallet

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Basically, we need to skin it with our logo/etc, but it's really coming along. Any KMD smartchain (except Pirate, because this is not currently compatible with zaddrs) can use this code. We will skin it and have it as an option where no blockchain is needed to be downloaded. But, no zaddrs or memo fields either. This wallet really shines for wallets on very low-resource devices or where bandwidth is expensive or slow

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> HUSH users will have a lot of options for wallets, soon. Mac/Linux/Win desktop SD, SD Android and our SilentDragon SuperLite wallet for Mac/Linux/Win/Android

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> So we will have a flavor of :SD:  and :SD:SL  for every OS

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Optimus_prime> Hmmm. Between Pirate and Hush what is the main difference?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Optimus_prime> @dukeleto you are in both team. So why 2 different entity with near identical techs?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <denio> Main difference: Hushlist, CC compatible

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <denio> Hush is for secure messaging. Arrr is to pay anonymous

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <denio> So different aims and some different tech. But yeah Hush and Arrr work together...and this is Rly smart if you ask me

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrd-hush] <ITM> @Optimus_prime 
On my side I have KMD + ARRR + Hush. [Global 10% of my profile]
I use KMD a lot for none crypto project. I use KMD to store small information and it get notarized. (Signatures) - Think about it as hash for a file. Cheaper to store information via kmd then directly via Bitcoin. 50% of profile
ARRR - I like it but its high risk. As for privacy, its offers decent privacy, not bulletproof. 10% of profile
Hush - Crypto condition, Hushlist and whatever zcash has. 40% of profile

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @Optimus_prime Hush is much older than Pirate, and the tech is similar to outsiders, but you need two different mainnets to try out 2 different sets of ideas. And we do have 2 different ways of doing things, with different implications

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @Optimus_prime Pirate enforces zaddrs-only at consensus layer, Hush does not. Pirate has the better strict privacy. Hush is the first pure-Sapling chain, and doesn't require 1.6GB of downloads, and we have UTXO-based smart contracts, pirate does not. Our emission schedules are pretty different as well

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> since I have code in Bitcoin and  Zcash and every Zcash source fork, it's not weird for me to work on 2 coins üôÇ

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Originally Hush was built on Zcash 1.0.8 codebase, and Hush and Pirate were initially much different. But then when Hush migrated to KMD 2.x codebase, we became much closer to Pirate. But still different enough

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @denio pretty much what you said, good summary üòâ
